member.summary: Maximum number of batch operations allowed to be executed at the same time. Each batch operation must acquire a , so this setting can be effectively used to limit the usage of ADO.NET connection pool by current journal.

member.summary: Maximum size of single batch of operations to be executed over a single .

member.name: P:Akka.Persistence.Sql.Common.Journal.BatchingSqlJournalSetup.MaxBufferSize
member.summary: Maximum size of requests stored in journal buffer. Once buffer will be surpassed, it will start to apply method to incoming requests.

member.name: P:Akka.Persistence.Sql.Common.Journal.BatchingSqlJournalSetup.AutoInitialize
member.summary: If true, once created, journal will run all SQL scripts stored under collection prior to starting executing any requests. In most implementation this is used to initialize necessary tables.

member.name: P:Akka.Persistence.Sql.Common.Journal.BatchingSqlJournalSetup.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Maximum time given for executed to complete.

member.name: P:Akka.Persistence.Sql.Common.Journal.BatchingSqlJournalSetup.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Isolation level of transactions used during query execution.

This exception is thrown for a couple of reasons.

An unknown isolation-level value was specified. Acceptable isolation-level values include: chaos | read-committed | read-uncommitted | repeatable-read | serializable | snapshot | unspecified
This exception is thrown when the specified is undefined.

member.name: T:Akka.Persistence.Sql.Common.Journal.BatchingSqlJournal`2
member.summary:
An abstract journal used by s to read/write events to a database.
This implementation uses horizontal batching to recycle usage of the and to optimize writes made to a database. Batching journal is not going to acquire a new DB connection on every request. Instead it will batch incoming requests and execute them only when a previous operation batch has been completed. This means that requests coming from many actors at the same time will be executed in one batch.
Maximum number of batches executed at the same time is defined by setting, while max allowed batch size is defined by setting.
Batching journal also defines , which defines a maximum number of all requests stored at once in memory. Once that value is surpassed, journal will start to apply logic on each incoming requests, until a buffer gets freed again. This may be used for overflow strategies, request denials or backpressure.
member.typeparam: A concrete implementation of for targeted database provider.
A concrete implementation of for targeted database provider.
